revised_title: Investigations of the Photochemical Law of the Silver Halide Grain in Photographic Plates
tldr: The authors investigate the photochemical behavior of individual silver halide grains in photographic plates, focusing on the factors that determine the blackening of the plate after exposure to light. They conclude that the grain or crystal of silver halide is the photochemical unit in the dry plate, and that the photochemical law of the silver halide grain is a crucial factor in understanding the photographic process.
